title: Blumberg theorem
summary: In mathematics, the Blumberg theorem states that for any real function f : R â†’ R {\displaystyle f:\mathbb {R} \to \mathbb {R} } there is a dense subset D {\displaystyle D} of R {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} } such that the restriction of f {\displaystyle f} to D {\displaystyle D} is continuous.
